summary: This is an email forwarding a letter from defense attorney Christian Everdell to Judge Alison Nathan regarding the sealing of a renewed bail motion in the case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The letter is to be filed under seal and submitted to the court and all counsel.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP who sent the letter to Judge Nathan regarding sealing the renewed bail motion for Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) for whom a renewed bail motion is being filed under seal.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge (Alison Nathan) presiding over the case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom the letter regarding sealing the bail motion is addressed.

persons.name: Bobbi C Sternheim
persons.context: Defense attorney copied on the email, with email address bcsternheim@mac.com.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense attorney copied on the email, with email address jpagliuca@hmflaw.com.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Defense attorney copied on the email, with email address lmenninger@hmflaw.com.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP, included in the email's recipient list.

connections.description: Everdell is submitting a sealed bail motion on behalf of defendant Maxwell.
Everdell is communicating with Judge Nathan regarding court procedures for sealing the bail motion.
Sternheim is part of Maxwell's defense team, as indicated by being copied on the email.
Pagliuca is part of Maxwell's defense team, as indicated by being copied on the email.
Menninger is part of Maxwell's defense team, as indicated by being copied on the email.
Both are attorneys at Cohen & Gresser LLP, as indicated in the email signature.

events.title: Submission of Sealed Bail Motion Letter
events.description: Defense attorney Christian Everdell submits a letter to Judge Nathan regarding the sealing of a renewed bail motion in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

keyFacts: A renewed bail motion for Ghislaine Maxwell was being prepared to be filed under seal in November 2020.
The defense team included attorneys Christian Everdell, Bobbi C Sternheim, Jeff Pagliuca, Laura Menninger, and Mark S. Cohen.
The communication was directed to Judge Alison Nathan, who was presiding over the case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
The law firm Cohen & Gresser LLP, with offices in New York, Paris, Washington DC, and London, was representing Maxwell.
The email highlights the procedural step of seeking court permission to seal the bail motion, indicating sensitive content.
